intro: Dimeria ciliata, commonly known as the silky dimeria, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant has a compact growth habit with hairy, ciliate (fringed) leaves that help reduce water loss in its dry environment. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or white and bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and moths. Dimeria ciliata is often found growing on rocky soils and is adapted to survive in extreme desert conditions.
